author: P. SHANE

review: I bought this to replace an aging Roku HD.  It is very sleek looking and the packaging is easy to open.  I was amazed when I first powered it on, because it was already configured for my Amazon Prime account.  Compared to Roku the Amazon Fire TV is biased towards Amazon Prime subscribers because its content is available from the home screen, but you need to install "Apps" to access other content such as Netflix or Crackle.  Roku was better this way because all content was installed as an "App" instead of giving any preference.  Roku's Netflix channel also "looks" better than Amazon Fire TV's Netflix channel, because the movie titles scale a lot bigger on the TV.I was disappointed that the Voice Search function only works for searching Amazon Apps or Prime content, but it doesn't work for other apps such as Netflix, it is text-only.  Another feature I would like is a menu for your favorite apps.  With all the apps you can install you really need a place to organize your favorite or most used apps, such as Netflix, Hulu and Crackle.  Without this all your apps look like an unorganized mess.Beware Amazon Fire TV doesn't replace an Xbox 360.  Xbox 360 also has installable apps (Netflix and Amazon Prime) and you can access most of them without an Xbox Live Gold account and it plays some great 3D next-gen games.  Amazon Fire TV games are comparable to using an android tablet with a quad-core CPU over an Xbox 360.  Think about this before you go diving head first into buying an Amazon Fire TV.
author: Dylan "Dylan"

review: I just set up my Amazon Fire TV.  I needed it because Amazon streaming wouldn't work with my 3 year old Apple TV.The picture is great and I like the voice search feature.  Setting up was easy.One thing is missing from the Fire TV that is important in this day and age.  Fire TV doesn't have an on/off switch.  After 30 minutes of non use it goes into standby mode which is still a power using mode.  The only fix according to my Amazon phone rep is to unplug the power cord.This is a modern world we live in and Amazon has been in the vanguard of new products but they missed big time on this.To be fair to our environment we must use less power, yet  the Fire TV is always on.I unplugged my power cord since I don't use Fire TV on a daily basis but it's a primitive fix.SHAME ON AMAZON for not having a power switch on the remote.
author: Patrick Regan

review: The concept is great. Very few useful apps, and many of the apps won't work. We have Prime and the Fire will often times refuse to play videos that the computer has no issue playing.
